This week I was lucky enough to experience the iconic New York autumn is I rolled into New York city there's something magical about fall in Manhattan It's that sweet spot between the summer humidity and the icy winter when you can actually walk around town
Feel good and things don't smell so bad
It was late afternoon when I checked into my hotel and dropped off my bags New York is a great walking city and nothing encourages that more than a hotel room the size of a pine cone
The streets were colorful as always and Halloween has hit the city have you ever complimented someone's costume and realized he was just a New Yorker wears a milk carton

When they finally get to the dog park they lose their minds
I sat next to one of the dog owners musician named Dave even though he was in sweat pants has long hair and cool Jean jacket said he was a rocker his dog look cool to he was a mutt named Rocco with a spike collar and an upper lip and permanent snarl
Davis lived in the village with Rocco his whole adult life and makes a living now is a studio musician he was lamenting about how the city's changed
There's no scene for the young bands anymore than New York used to be a city of artists weirdos who were too strange to live in their hometowns but now there's nothing left at the weirdos can afford
